page.title: 10CARLISLE RACE_COURSE
page.content: There used to be a race_course in the centre of Carlisle but it is now a pitch and putt golf course.The old grandstand is still there but derelict and has a preservation order on it.The present race_course at Durdar used to be part of the Blackhall Estate.The course was opened 56 years ago and is one of only 18 dual_purpose courses (flat and National Hunt racing).It was the first,by half an hour,to open an indicator board,beating Newmarket because the owner brought the day's racing forward by 30 minutes.Only 3 full_time workers are employed,the foreman,the groundsman and a tractor driver.Racing is held on 18 days in the year and many temporary staff are taken on to run the restaurants and bars.The course itself is 1.5 miles long and is regarded as a tough test for horses being uphill near the end.
